text: My first code was a way to get the idea of a standardised API client out the door. After last weekend I think I found a base to create that client (<https://github.com/xwero/HubSpot-psr7/issues/1>). There is still a lot of work to do, but I feel like I going in right direction.

Hello <@UFBDBKQ1H>
I check this issue right now
There are a 400 request. I try to solve this :wink:
Hi <@UFEMNG3RA>, great hopefully you can get that 400 error resolved. I think the original issue you reported here may be to with your OAuth process.
The main steps for the oauth process are:
Listed here from 1-4 in the Oauth overview process:<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/oauth2/oauth2-overview>
I also set up a test app and went through the oauth process and created a CRM card on the contact record in a test portal and it worked OK for me.
If I can help any further please just let me know

Hi Everyone.
I wanted to know if there is a way to get the deals from the last 60 days using the Deals API. I only managed to get the last 30 days.
Using the API, is there a way to tell what HubSpot subscription levels a portal has?

Can anyone point me towards a resource on building a bridge between a custom database and HubSpot — very limited api experience. Data entry needs to start in custom database and update current HubSpot contact records, if a new one is added HubSpot needs to create a new one as well. Thought about using hidden form fields but then there'd be no way for HubSpot to send the HubSpot id # back to custom db.
what languages you familiar with, and what DB?
It's a membership database for an association, roughly 2800 records... dev'd in mysql
and it’s just a 1 way sync yeah?
Yes, but I suppose maybe a 2 way because we need HubSpot to send back the hub ID to the DB
Is there a way to associate a HubSpotutk with a contact without using the form submission api? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form> and without javascript?
So two way is a bit more complicated. Either way you’ll likely need some custom code (as it’s a custom db)
Do you know what programming language you want to use?
Is it doable in ASP or PHP?
yeah absolutely
<https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-php>
very nice. Thank you!
You will want to use API keys rather than the oauth flow.. as it’s server -> server communication.
